data.content: For those who are complaining about the energy system, it's just something they had to put in there otherwise people would finish the levels too quickly and they have added a way to get round this by buying the 24 hour unlimited hearts. Also for the people complaining about how it's annoying when you have score so many goals (1 level you have to score 7 but 4 of them are penalties) use the cash, when you have lost the ball when you are about to score the final goal just click the rewind button if you have no cash then it will take you to the screen to buy cash, but just click the free cash from a ad button and you'll rewind for the equivalent of watching a simple ad. I personally love this game it doesn't swarm you with ads especially when your actually playing the game and your in a match which is great. The graphics are good and the overall game play is great. I love how you can get free cash from watching ads because it saves you from spending money, I am on 130 cash right now because I just sit watching ads whilst watching tv or something like that and when I finish I have gained over 50 cash. I have my character exactly the way I wanted it and when I finish a season with a little to short stars I just watch those ads and get into it for free. Great game:) Recommend to download it.
data.title: Great game

data.content:
Great clever concept, allows you to look for that perfect pass as you move up the pitch with you star player, completing each scenario in turned based fashion.

If you fancy yourself a Pirlo, you'll love it.

Plenty of playability, the pay-as-you-go side is quite onerous, so expect to shell out possibly £50 if you want to progress quickly, otherwise you're at the mercy of the 'timer'.

This is a shame because it spoils a good game.

In terms of gameplay, it would be better to not have the game rewind too far back when you miss a pass or shot, and you've already scored twice -thats annoying. 

And i don't understand why your player doesn't have more angles to play the ball -that doesn't make sense and forced you to make arbitrary passes.

Career story, has the right idea, but they need to throw in some modern football first world problems, to keep it entertaining e.g media questions etc.
data.title: Pass master

data.content: I really like the idea of this game but like every other review I've read there are a couple of flaws. The energy system is crap, when you have to score 3 goals its almost impossible because on the 3rd level one bad pass and you're back to the very beginning. The developers really should listen to these review. Just charge £5.99 for the app, get rid of the energy thing and sort out the level thing. I can't tell you how many times it's taken me to score three goals, especially when i've just about completed a pass and the opposition fly in from nowhere and head it away. It just absolute REAKS of money grabbing tactics and it really casts a shadow on an otherwise fun game.
data.title: Great idea but could be done better

data.content:
Played this game on several devices now, hoping each time I delete and reinstall that the developers would notice a few HUGE problems with this game. But alas, no. This game would be fantastic if; You didn't have to repeat all scenarios in a level if you fail on the 3rd. (Or pay...).
If your players ACTUALLY MOVED or jumped to attempt to receive passes, instead a defender runs half the length of the pitch and heads the ball away as your player STANDS THERE STATIONARY. 
If this game was fixed to these standards it would be a 5* masterpiece of mobile gaming in my opinion but in its current state it's not fun or enjoyable in the slightest. If I could give it Zero stars I would.
data.title: Waste of time.

data.content: I absolutely love this game and have been addicted to it for God-knows how long. Recently, I've picked the game up again after not playing for a few months and I've discovered that some levels are exact, identical copies of other levels which I have played before. I am on Season 22 which is an incredible landmark, yes, but I have noticed it is the same level but in a different position within the game. I am curious as to what this is - an intentional deliberation as the game developers were bored/had a lack of enthusiasm to create another game scenario (if this is the case, I am not necessarily annoyed but would be slightly disappointed as the target audience were not told in advance) or is this a genuine accident?
data.title: Message to Developers

data.content: Score hero is brilliantly addictive, so much so I've completed all available levels and am now going through my 1 star levels to try to up them to 2 or 3 stars. This is when it's a little frustrating, many levels require you to place the ball in either a specific or either bottom corner, and despite meeting this criteria, it doesn't register as going in the bottom corner. I've tried putting it right in the bottom corner of the netting, in to the side netting, just behind the post but it often just doesn't accept it. I really like the level of frustration this game can cause but that's a little too much! Please fix or at least let me know what I need to do to get it in the 'bottom corner'.
data.title: Best game on App Store, one tiny gripe...
